Key Arguments: The bill is seen as a violation of free speech rights.
The government is not transparent about the bill's contents and objectives.
The definitions of misinformation and disinformation are politically flexible and vague.
Existing laws are sufficient to address misinformation without infringing on free speech.
The bill could be used to criminalize dissent and free speech.
The government exempts itself from the bill, which is seen as hypocritical.
Notable Quotes: I am totally opposed to the so-called Misinformation Bill now before federal Parliament.
The Government appears unwilling to be fully frank about the punitive aspects of this Bill.
This Bill could therefore be used in conjunction with Acts already in place to criminalize free speech and legitimate dissent in Australia.
The Bill might as well say the Minister can make it up as he or she goes along.
